Name.label: Syndromic neurometabolic disease with X-linked intellectual disability

TextSection.Contents: Infantile glycerol kinase deficiency (GKD) is a severe form of GKD (see this term) characterized clinically by poor feeding, failure to thrive, salt-wasting dehydration, vomiting, Addisonian pigmentation, hypotonia, and disorders of consciousness. Some patients have complex GKD associated with adrenal hypoplasia congenita and/or Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) (see these terms) with manifestations including intellectual deficit, dysmorphic facial features, abnormal external genitalia, strabismus, seizures, and progressive lethargy.

Name.label: NTBT (narrower term maps to a broader term)
